Posts.Content: Hi Yvonne, I had my 3rd FEC yesterday and today I am feeling pretty damn good!  First FEC wasn't great, 2nd FEC was hideous and I was very sick and felt completely crap but so far this one has been much better.  That's the strange thing I have found with FEC it never seems to affect you the same each time, which is a bit unsettling as you never quite know what to expect. Not sure what to advise you really, as one of the other ladies has said you could try and postpone it if you really want to do the interview (which sounds great by the way!).  I dread them postponing any of mine as my last one is due on 14th December and I so want mine to be finished by Christmas - not least because I have a 4 and 9 year old!  Good luck with whatever you decide, if only we could predict what the dreaded FEC would do to us it would be much easier wouldn't it? All the best to you, it sounds a fab opportunity.   Michele xx
Posts.Title: Help! I need to be well 2 days post chemo!

Posts.Content: Hi Tokes, I didn't feel a thing when my was taken out, I didn't even know they had done it!  It's nothing like getting it fitted put it that way!  I bet you can't wait to have a nice soak in the bath :-)   Michele xx
Posts.Title: PICC Line

Posts.Content: Hi there, I had this following FEC and it is really unpleasant.  I got some Stemitel from my doctor which is used to treat vertigo and such things and it cured it instantly.  I would make an appointment with your doctor and see if you can get something like that.  It's a horrible feeling isn't it. Good luck.   Michele xx
Posts.Title: spining room and nausea

Posts.Content: Hi Sammy, Just wanted to send you a big hug.  I am an identical twin and currently fighting grade 3 breast cancer which my beautiful sister is supporting me with.  A while ago she suffered a brain hemorrhage and the thought of losing her was just too awful to contemplate, thankfully she survived and I was very pleased to be by her side with her recovery, she in turn is now here for me too. I know how tough it is to watch your sister suffer so much and for me seeing her suffer was far worse than going through what I am right now, as other people have said I think it is far worse for the families than it is for the cancer suffers.  As also mentioned, the treatments for cancer are improving all the time and she is being treated in a really great place. My advice to you is to be there for her as much as possible, do all the things you want to do together as much as her health allows and tell her how much you love her.  Make every day count.  My heart and warm wishes go out to you both, stay strong for each other and the very best of luck to your sister on her journey. Take care Sammy.   Michele xx

Posts.Title: 1st chemo today...today I start fighting back!

Posts.Content: Hello Sheila, Welcome to the club nobody wants to join! I am sorry you have found yourself here but there are lots of lovely ladies to help you on your journey. I was diagnosed with the same as you in July (Grade 3 Invasive Ductal Cancer) and had a wide local excision on 13th July.  I have so far had 3 x FEC and will be having my 4th on Friday.  My symptoms have varied on each one but non of them have been unbearable or made me take to my bed!  I have 2 children aged 4 and 9 years and I have still been able to take them and fetch them from school each day and go about my general business.  The first few days after chemo I feel a bit dizzy but nothing too bad. I am absolutely terrified of needles so opted to have a PICC line fitted which was done 2 days before my chemo started and I am so glad I did.  All my chemo goes through it and they take my blood out of it.  There isn't anybody trained to flush a PICC line at my surgery and initially I was doing a 66 mile round trip every Friday to get it flushed but the hospital have now trained my sister to do it and she does it for me every week - much easier!  I would definitely recommend the PICC line as I haven't had any problems with it and I don't really know its there any more. Everybody's journey is individual but we are all here to help and support each other.  I have had tremendous support off the lovely ladies on here and I am sure you will too.  Good luck with your journey, I hope it becomes less frightening as you go along. Take care.   Michele xx
Posts.Title: New to the Group worrying about the whole Breast Cancer situation...

Posts.Content: What a  lovely post to read Tinkers, I am really pleased your journey has finished (sort of!).  Mine is just beginning so I envy you!! I am waiting for my PICC line to be fitted, how did you get on with it?  I hope you do something nice to celebrate the end of treatment and your birthday, you certainly deserve it. Take care.   Michele xx
Posts.Title: Finished my treatment today!

Posts.Content: Evening all :-) As the title says really, I had my first FEC on 31st August and was just wondering when my hair would start to fall out.  I have shaved it really short but its still all in tact at the moment.  I keep waking up every day expecting to find it on my pillow but nothing so far!  I am not using the cold cap by the way.  Got my next FEC next Friday. Thank you Michele xx

I am having my second FEC next Friday, so 5 more to go for me, I can't wait to be where you are now. A couple of questions about the PICC line - did you have a waterproof cover for it and if so where did you get it from and also did it hurt when they took it out?  I had mine flushed today but have to do a 60 mile round trip for them to do it which is a complete waste of time and money!  They have agreed to train my sister to do it next week, can't wait. I wish you well with your continuing journey and hope you enjoy your new found freedom :-) Take care   Michele xx

Posts.Content: Thanks for the replies ladies.  Hello Wendy, well done on reaching the end of your treatment, I am back there tomorrow for FEC number 3!  It is a real worry isn't it, I keep having pains in my back and have convinced myself it has spread - more likely its because of the amount of weight I have put on because I can't stop eating :-)  But it really worries me because often by the time you get any symptoms like pain etc, its too late.  I am going to ask tomorrow and see what they say. Thanks again ladies. Michele xx
Posts.Title: How do I know if its spread?

Posts.Content: Hello ladies, I am having a minor panic, please help!! I was diagnosed with grade 3 breast cancer in July after I found a small lump in my breast.  I had a wide local excision followed by 6 X FEC (going for the 3rd one on Friday) then radiotherapy and Tamoxifen.  My question is why do they give some women CT scans etc and not others?  I have had no other tests or scans to see if it is anywhere else so how do they know it isn't? I will ask my oncologist this when I see him on 25th October but just wondered if anybody here knew the answer in the meantime.  i had a pain in my back yesterday and was convinced it had spread to my lungs! Thanks in advance.   Michele xx
Posts.Title: How do I know if its spread?

Posts.Content: Thanks for the replies ladies, I'm not sure how it works at my hospital (the Norfolk & Norwich University Hospital) as a friend of mine has breast cancer (grade 2) and she has had MRi and CT scans and she is being treated at the same hospital. I will ask when I have my chemo on Friday. God what a worry this horrid disease is!  Thanks again ladies.   Michele x
Posts.Title: How do I know if its spread?

I am starting 6 sessions of FEC on 31st August and have been advised that all my hair will fall out by week 3 (lovely!).  I have 2 children aged 4 and 9 and this is really freaking them out so I am going to get them to help me shave it off but before I do that I just wanted to ask if anybody had managed to keep their hair on FEC without using the cold cap?  Don't want to rush in with the shears in case there is a chance it might not fall out.  Think I'm clutching at straws really!! Thanks Michele xx
Posts.Title: FEC and hair loss

Posts.Content: Thank you ladies for all your replies, I now know what to expect - thank you.  I have decided to chop mine off before it starts falling out because that will really creep me out!  My hairdresser is going to come to my house and shave it to a number 2 and put some swirls and stuff in it which my daughters are going to help with (should be interesting!).  I will then shave it further when it falls out.  Thought it might be easier for the girls to see me with a bit of hair before it all goes rather than seeing me bald immediately!  I'm off to the scarf folding workshop on 21st August so can buy lots of pretty hats/scarves etc. before it falls out.  I have decided not to have a wig,  living on the very windy North Norfolk coast is not ideal wig weather! I think once its gone I will feel better about it.  At least it will grow back, could be worse my teeth could fall out then I really would be scuppered!!! Thanks again for your support ladies, it's great to hear you all so positive. Michele xx
Posts.Title: FEC and hair loss

Posts.Content: Oh Christine, I am sorry to hear you are feeling so down.  I have my first FEC on 31st August so will be thinking of you too. I can't offer any words of wisdom I'm afraid as I haven't started on the rocky chemo path yet but I am just trying to think of it like you are, that it is a preventative treatment and is a relatively short period of time out of our lives so we can get on with the rest of our lives. Really pleased the steroids are helping with your back pain, that's an unexpected bonus :-) Keep your chin up hun, it will soon be over and we will be fighting fit again. Michele xxx
Posts.Title: FEC and hair loss

Posts.Content: Hi Amanda, I am going for my 2nd FEC on Friday and like you had really thick hair when I started.  Initially I had mine cut very short then shaved it on number 4 but yesterday it really started coming out so have had it shaved to number 1.  I look like GI Jane!!!!!  I did mine gradually to try and cause minimal upset to my daughters who are 4 and 9 and I'm glad I did that.  My scalp wasn't really sore but it felt like I had a ponytail in so was a bit tender, now I have shaved my head that feeling has almost gone.  I have been told though that it feels a bit like that when it grows back but obviously can't confirm that yet!  If you don't want to shave the whole lot off in one go perhaps you could have a really short cut (I mean really short!) then when you are used to seeing yourself like that (maybe after a couple of days) shave it to number 1, that might be easier to get your head around. The way I am dealing with it is by telling myself (and my daughters) that it's only a temporary thing and that it will grow back.  At least its not my teeth that have fallen out because they wouldn't grow back!! Good luck with whatever you decide.  I have found that I am addicted to buying scarves now!!! Take care   Michele xx

Have fun xxxxxxx
